channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for AZ
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for AZ

item.title: Report X-2023120673
item.description:
Report X-2023120673

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-04
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: package was being unloaded when it was discovered that the top and sides were wet. The package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote, the bottle top was tightened down and the tote was brought to the QA area for processing. DescribePack: One bottle top came loose during the shipping process causing the bottle to leak. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The bottle top was tightened down.

item.title: Report X-2023120700
item.description:
Report X-2023120700

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-08T00:36:07+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-11
  • City: TEMPE
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found outside of a drivers truck and put into a lined hazmat tote and taken to the hazmat cage. DescribePack: The closure on the inner container was loose causing the inner container to leak damaging the box. DurationRel: 5 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed into a lined hazmat tote with orientation arrows up.

item.title: Report X-2024010008
item.description:
Report X-2024010008

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-18
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A 5 GALLON METAL BUCKET WITH A FLAMMABLE LIQUID DIAMOND LABEL AND SHIPPING PAPERS ON AN IREGG CART NEAR THE HAZMAT AREA. THE IREGG STAFF INFORMED RESPONDER THE BUCKET HAD A SLIGHT ODOR TO IT. DURING INSPECTION OF THE 5 GALLON BUCKET, DISCOVERED THE TOP/LID DENTED AND LEAKING. THE 5 GALLON BUCKET WAS PROCESSED WITHOUT ISSUES.

item.title: Report X-2023121135
item.description:
Report X-2023121135

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD DOOR 7 THAT WAS WET AND BEARING A CORROSIVE AND OXIDIZER LABEL. RESPONDER CONTAINED THE LEAKER FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE AND TRANSPORTED THE PACKAGE TO THE HAZMAT AREA FOR PROCESSING.

item.title: Report X-2023121134
item.description:
Report X-2023121134

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-05T18:16:01+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: TUCSON
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKER IN THE UNLOAD DOOR 6, THE PACKAGE WAS WET ON THE BOTTOM AND WAS BEARING A CORROSIVE 8 AND OXIDIZER 5.1 LABEL. FOLLOWING THE DECISION TREE, RESPONDER CONTAINED THE LEAKER AND TRANSPORTED THE LEAKER TO THE HAZMAT AREA TO PROCESS.

item.title: Report E-2023120454
item.description:
Report E-2023120454

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-02T15:11:53+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: PHOENIX
  • State: AZ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: It was reported that approximately 25 gallons of Penray NC Brake Cleaner (UN1206) were released from (1) 55-gallon DM due to improper loading. The release impacted the trailer floor. The SDS was reviewed with the terminal and determined that terminal personnel are capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. (1) 65 gallon DF contains (1) 55-gallon DM partially full of product and (1) 20 gallon DF contains impacted absorbents were created as waste and left onsite for the terminal to manage.
